artist: Artist: Yamamura Kōka (Toyonari); Publisher: Yamamura Kōka Hanga Kankōkai
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and torso of man with large nose, head turned to PL side, wearing black and blue garments, holding a baby in purple and brown striped cloth
markings: red artist\'s seal: 豊成 {Toyonari} | date seal: 大拾 {Tai jū} (1921)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled actor series, sometimes called Flowers of the Theatrical World (Rien no hana 梨園の華)
text: Sixth design in a set of twelve. Based on Ichimura Uzaemon XV (1874-1945) as the Gardener (uekiya) Kichigorō in the play Midareyaki みだれ焼, performed at the Imperial Theater, June 1921. The premier of this play that was adaptated by Enomoto Torahiko 榎本虎彦 (Haryū 破笠, 1866-1916) after a manuscript by Fukuchi Ōchi 福地桜痴 (Gen'ichirō 源一郎, 1841-1906), was at the Kabuki Theater, January 1907.
title: Actor Ichimura Uzaemon XV as the Gardener Kichigorō
